profile.bio: Kevin Houk is from Falls Church, Virginia close to the DC metropolitan area. He started taking an interest in technology at the age of 12, when his father helped him build his first computer. In 2012, Kevin became captain of an Air Force Association's cyber-security competition team. Out of 1,600 teams that competed nationwide, Kevinâ€™s team placed 2nd. Kevin has also worked for the Northrop Grumman Corporation in conducting penetration testing and cloud research.  Kevin entered the bitcoin world a little over a year ago, and fried multiple graphics cards mining bitcoin along the way. Currently, Kevin is on loan from Penn State University in the honors program, majoring in Security & Risk Analysis with an option of Cyber Security.
